reviews.review_msg: He is a genius. I like his classes. I got a D from William Krane's PSYC210, and had to retake with Maraun. What Krane didn't explain, Maraun did. In fact, Maraun taught us great stats theories.I learned nothing about stats from Krane, but all from Maraun!
Hard course. He doesn't understand why we don't understand. Doesn't make complicated material any easier.

She is a very caring professor and easy to talk to! However, her lectures can seem disorganized as she will often flip between slides and tends to make up example questions off the top of her head. I would definitely recommend going to the study sessions she puts on - they were very helpful!

This is essentially Stats Lite(tm) for non stats students. It's hard, we don't like it. Snjezana knows this, and gosh darn if she doesn't try her hardest to ease the struggle a little. No textbook, so class is mandatory, but recorded lectures. Willing to adapt to needs. Participation marks galore. Study groups she organizes and teaches herself.
I think she means well but she's completely disorganized. Doesn't explain concepts clearly. Lectures are dull. Take it with someone else if you can.

I enjoy this professor. She is very passionate about what she teaches and that helps make the somewhat dry lecture material more interesting. The tutorials are helpful with this course, as some material needs to be reviewed a few times before it is clear. Attendance is mandatory for lectures most of the time because of in-lecture assignments.

I'm already feeling really lost in this course. She's really unclear, disorganized, and difficult to understand. I don't think she's good at teaching statistics. Every week I'm completely confused in lecture and then I have to go to tutorial and ask my TA to make things clear.

She is really nice, but completely disorganized and incomprehensible. She makes the material seem more confusing than it is because she's not good at explaining it, and then when you go to your tutorial you realize it's not confusing at all. I also don't appreciate how she talks to students like they're children.

LOVE this prof. I went into this course thinking i'd fail and probably get kicked out of SFU since I was already on AP. The semester isn't over yet but I am getting a B-. The thing about this course is that you need to go in it with a critical mind, not one of an arts student. (stop asking why is so and so this). As for the prof she is amazing.

Snejz is an amazing prof who takes time to make sure her students understand the material. She is a life saver during office hours and provides clarity. My TA, Ashley, also was also a life saver & made the course much easier because they made sure we understood & she was always available for appointments. Overall, tough course & hard work pays off!

Really nice professor. She cares about her students to succeed in her course. Go to her office hours when you are confused with anything, she will try her best to make you understand. Tutorial is really helpful. She tends to make lecture slide really small when she is writing, tell her to zoom in. Test was long and tough, grade was scaled.
Assignment should weight more cause it needs lots of work. Exams are count for 90% which is way too hard. This is psyc course but not math course; the grading standard should be changed.

I managed to get an OK grade in this course, despite putting in more time and effort than any of my other classes. Do all the readings, attend lab and lectures, and do practice and a B should be attainable. The grade cutoff for an A is 88%...

Extremely sweet lady. Our success seems to be just as important to her as it is to us. However, her lectures are very confusing and all over the place, which is not helpful for statistics. Exams are quite easy. Assignments were decent. TAs are very helpful and everything you need to know is taught in lab. GO TO LAB. Textbook is not very helpful.

Snejz is a super nice lady, very kind hearted. However, she can't teach this course. It's super confusing in lecture and most of the time she'll confuse you more. Had an amazing TA who made everything make sense though but all in all, you'll have to do a lot of teaching yourself to get a decent grade here.

Though she is probably one of the nicest profs, she is disorganized and things are very confusing. That being said, however, this was her first time teaching so I am sure that she will take everything into consideration and be much improved for next time. I'll probably see you for that next time cause I probably didn't get the required C :(

Probably the nicest prof I've ever had. Really cares about her students doing well and goes out of her way to help them. if you put in the effort to actually understand the content and get extra help, she's more than happy to walk you through it.

She is just horrible. Lectures are way too confusing and marks terribly hard. DO NOT take this class if you don't have to. Super disorganized and boring. Does not post slides online and the notes she writes in class are not understandable at all. Textbook sucks

She said in the first class that she will only be going over the textbook content in lecture and making it simpler to understand. She was very wrong. Class material is totally different than both textbook and lab material. You have to know all 3. She is very nice but very confusing. Exams are not hard at all, as long as you get the material.

She is ridiculously disorganized. She comes to class always complaining about being low on sleep (just get your act together and get more sleep, don't whine to us) as a way to excuse her constant mistakes in lectures/assignments/exams. Then she excuses it with "c'est la vie" and "I'm human". Avoid taking the class with her, it's a trainwreck.
She's super nice!

Very nice lady and means well. With that said, she doesnt post lecture slides, so you just have to write everything she says or draws down. The course itself is pretty confusing- and for a Q course I think it would be more fair to have notes to refer to instead of writing down whatever you can. tests are HARD, wordy and vague and way too long.

have to attend to class otherwise you won't find anything she talks about on the textbook. Lecture notes are not posted online. The material is hard to follow since there are no additional information available other than her words during lecture
Really not a bad prof at all.he is a bit strange, but if you are willing to do the work,it will pay off.Go to class, ask Q's and use the tutroials to your advantage-they actually help!

very good professor!! nice and easy going very helpful!! teaching tend to follow Dr. Mike Maraun's style. If you can really concentrated on what is being taught although task is difficult you will still be able to get a A!! overall an excellent man but you need to work hard and he will help you!!

Has a large ego and a poor attitude towards students.  If you attend his lectures, prepare to be insulted. He's often passive-aggressively hostile towards the audience. Thankfully, his teaching contract has not been renewed...

Terrible teacher, very monotone and his lectures are incredibly uninteresting even though I like this subject. His exams are the hardest I've taken and focus on specifics that are unrelated to the course. Very reliant on textbook. His powerpoints lack crucial information. Worst class I've taken thus far.

This prof makes the topics clear and easy to go through, the TA's can make or break the class but definitely take it upon yourself to stay on top of the weeks and ensure you know what each week entails as this class goes very fast after the first midterm. Adam does his part by being accessible anytime needed and posts video lectures to refer to.

The exams in this class are disproportionately difficult and ask too many questions that are worded weird in a small amount of time. Our final exam average was 55 percent! Lectures are very heavy and you definitely need to attend. The only reason people are able to get a decent grade is cuz it's curved and the assignments

This is one of the best profs I've ever taken. Lectures are very detailed and interesting, although are 2 hrs long. The quizzes and assignments are fairly easy if you learn the material. Midterm and final exams were fair. Prof is quick at responding to emails and gives detailed responses. I would 100% recommend this prof for psyc 210.

his assignments and quiz's saved my grades. exams were much harder than they needed to be. Exam wording was so weird and hard to understand in a time crunch. keep up with the lecture and tutorials and text. Go to tut even if participation isn't marked. it saved me!

Dr. Blanchard made this intimidating class very manageable. Being someone who has not done math since high school, I was worried. No breaks in lecture, so they can feel long, but he explains everything clearly and is very organized. Assignments were a good way to show understanding and save your grade if you are not great under a time crunch!

Despite not doing the best in the class, it was not at fault from Adam. He is a good prof and explains the topics very well. There are weekly quizzes. The content can be difficult, but if you keep up and make sure not to fall behind in the class then you'll do fine.

Adam is a really slow talker but he has his recordings are prerecorded so you can put it on 2x, trust me, he's very very very slow. But aside from that, he's honestly such a caring and great prof! His lectures are amazing and super clear. He gives example exams before the exams too!

Had Adam for PSYC210 in the Spring 2020 semester and he was great! For someone who hasnt done any math since high school, Adam really made this course a breeze! My friend and I both got an A- and we happily shocked. Definitely a harder class, but if you put the work in, youll get a good grade!

Adam was an amazing professor, his lectures were straight to the point and he included many examples. The textbook was really important in expanding on lecture material so be sure to go through that. The class is hardwork but if you do the practice questions every week you can easily succeed. He also gives no breaks in a 2 hour lecture so be ready!

I wish he was teaching more classes, I'd take them all. One of the nicest, caring and most patient profs I've had. Also very well organized, everything is super accessible and clear - lecture slides with annotations and recordings, assignments, practice materials. I honestly don't think you could find anyone better to teach you statistics intro.

Dr. Sigal clearly cares about his students & does his best to make stats make sense. I have an LD in math, but he was able to teach in a way that I was able to learn & understand. Extremely nice & endlessly patient if you're struggling & need him to reteach something. Also the most disability-aware prof I've ever had, which I really appreciate.
Nice guy, records lectures and offer office hours. Course material is very boring and lectures are very dry.

Lecture heavy, but he tries to make it engaging. Slides have step-by-step solutions, but going to tutorials helps solidify the content taught during class. Exams are fair and scaled, but you need to know your stuff to finish on time.  Provides enough practice which helps (DO THEM). Approachable, organized, and caring. Classes are recorded.

The lecture content was quite heavy and some things were more difficult to understand just from matt's lectures. However, The tutorial was a game changer. The ta's will go through materials you should know and will make matts material seem easier. I highly suggest to never miss a tutorial if you want to succeed. The tests were fair.

mid prof at best. he goes on a tangent on stuff we already did and then rushed through important and new content. people bash him bcz the course is hard but he isn't bad just not great. if you know up to grade 7 math thats all u need, the course is really about knowing steps of tests and concepts rather than math. my TA Megan graham was the best

a cool guy, but his teaching method definitely is not for everyone. tends to breeze through lectures and important concepts due to the time limit. make sure to practice and do the recommended questions at the end of each lecture!! it's so, so easy to fall behind. also 100% contact the TAs or him if you need help. (bert was a goat TA)

Dr. Sigal is very good at explaining the concepts. I just feel like having the midterm (35%) and final (40%) being worth so much makes you grade not look so good, specially because there are lots of formulas. Maybe if he switched some of the grading to weekly quizzes, it would be better. Be ready to study, the textbook does not really help.

he takes an eternity to go over what we need to learn. 1/3 of class is taught before MT, and the rest is taught for the final. hes a nice guy but still lots of improvement to go as a proff. nothing against the guy but his teaching method doesnt work. most got a good grade this sem because of a whatsapp groupchat rather than sigal or some TA's.

Matthew was a great prof, talked in a way that made sense and was quite engaging and not monotone. This is a hard course though, which it not really the prof's fault. There are some really long lectures that he rushed through, but he just needed to cover all the material.

Sigal is a good prof, he does his best to make things clear and ensure that students are able to get help to further that understanding. While 210 is very difficult it is not the profs fault. I really stress that you practice for this course repetition is what will help you in the final as it relies heavily on application over understanding.

Took this course in Summer 2022. No clue why this guys rating is so low. He was able to turn a very boring and somewhat difficult topic into a straightforward and interesting math class Watch his lectures (he posts them), GO TO TUTORIAL (most important) and study a few days before the exam and you'll do well. Great professor and very nice.

Dr. Sigal is probably the best prof I've had at SFU. He explained concepts really well, the lecture materials were really organized (he posted lecture slides, annotated lecture slides, and an old lecture video recording for each week). This was the first math class I've taken in like 3 years and he made it super easy to do well :)
He's an awesome teacher and makes his lectures very engaging and entertaining. He made me enjoy statistics, which is wild.

Dr. Sigal was awesome. I hate math and stats, but even with the dry and tough material he was able to explain it in a digestible way. He was always patient with the class and my TA was so good. This class is really hard though, if you don't study or go to the lectures you won't do well.

I struggle a lot with statistics and Matt was the first professor whos ever made me actually understand and sometimes even enjoy learning them. He is approachable and willing to help you succeed! Its a hard class and a lot of work is needed though, so expect to put a lot of time into it if stats doesnt come easy to you.

For the average psyc student this class is not super accessible. Lecture slides were very disorganized, which made it hard to study and my TA was wildly unhelpful. If quantitative work is not your strong suit, just do your best to pass.

I don't understand how it is expected for students to pass when stat formulas are not labelled properly in slides, half-measured examples, required textbook has errors with completely different stat formulas, assignment questions and exams are trick-based and graded heavily. Nobody should have this treatment if they are just wanting a BA. Not nice

He's a great professor who tried his best honestly. The class was hard for an intro one and I highly recommend putting in the effort from the very beginning! Go to tutorials and use the TA as a resource!Ask them anything and everything!Also, I hated how the 2 assignments were the only way to get easy marks and I am forever mad. Forget the textbook.

Dr. Sigal makes stats easy to digest. Hes a good prof and a nice guy overall. The final was more fair than the midterm imo, but overall I enjoyed stats much more than I thought I would. Going to lectures is also really important for this class, he breaks things down easily.
Cared about his students success - lectures were engaging for a stats course and simplified

Here is the thing, the guy isn't a bad teacher. He is a pretty nice guy but his exams are pretty difficult. ESPECIALLY if you have no previous knowledge with stats. The midterm was on 7 chapters, the 7th being taught a week prior to the exam and one of the most challenging chapters. 95% of the exam was on the last 2 chapters. Everyone did poorly.

Surprised by the harsh reviews, I feel he makes stats engaging and relatively easy. Taking this class made me want to take 301 with him. He's really approachable and understanding, and his lectures make sense. He cares a lot about his students. I have a great TA for this course (Bert) which helps a lot, students in other sections seem to struggle.

Super nice guy and really does care about the students. He does talk slow and makes sure everyone understands. The assignments are a great grade booster and make sure to study for the online exams. I found them a bit difficult.

I have taken two classes with Dr. Sigal and have enjoyed them both. Psyc 210 is heavy on math and understanding concepts. Lectures are incredibly helpful for grasping material ( I did not use my textbook after Week 2) and Dr. Sigal is a funny guy. If Ric is your TA and you attend your tutorials and do the worksheets, you'll absolutely do well.

Idk why he has a low rating. He explains stat concepts very well and always gives a summary of what we already know before moving on to the next lecture. He started the class discussing the importance of stats and helped me realize how I need to be good at it for research, making me take 301 w him next sem. Nothing more I could ask for in a prof.
Nice guy, the exams were fair and the assignments were pretty easy. I didn't have to try very hard and still got a decent mark.
Don't understand how the professor expects students to pass this stats class when exams are graded so heavily. There is a reason we are majoring in psychology and not math...

BE AWARE OF THE GATEKEEPER OF PSYCH! Just try to pass, do your best. He talks super fast and doesn't take questions during his lectures. TA was completely incompetent and spent 2 hours explaining a problem that he could not solve himself.

Matt is a good prof. His lectures can be a bit hard to focus on because he tends to talk as though he's reading a bedtime story but you can tell he's passionate about stats! His assignments and tests are fair; assignments are more calculations and tests focus more on concepts. You definitely have to know more than just how to do the math.

This class is verydry but he did his best to make it interesting and was great at reducing stress. All in all would take again, he is kind and approachable and if you can go to his office hours! it helps so much

Great class! I really ENJOY taking class with Dr. Mattew. It was a great data analysis course with useful information! One downside is the final is cumulative, get your self review from beginning of the semester and well prepared!!

He's very nice and respects students. The exams can be a bit difficult, really need to memorize and understand the materials well to do well in class. Otherwise he is passionate about the subjects he teaches just overall a good prof.

Dr. Sigal obviously loves what he teaches and it makes the topic more interesting. The textbook isnt needed if you go to lectures and pay attention he doesnt test outside what he covers in lectures. Tests arent hard if you understand the lectures and assignments are easy because you can use your notes. One of the best profs Ive had so far

I stayed on top of the coursework for majority of the chapters except the last 2 before the first midterm. The entire exam was based off the last two chapter :( Over half of what he taught in class wasn't tested. On top of that the exam was really really long but out of 35 marks and 35% of the grade. Don't take heavy courses while taking this one.

Dr. Sigal teaches this class very well. Just be super focussed and attentive in lecture. I took this class in the summer as intersession. It was more than doable. I personally really enjoyed this class and the TA (Ric Hohn) was by far the best TA at SFU. The textbook problems that Dr. Sigal assigns at the end of each lecture are not too difficult.
worst class Ive ever take! Dont miss a class and tutorials. He is hard to understand and his exam questions are terrible. The exam is so long and it is hard to finish it.

Matt was nice, but lectures weren't that informative. I went to every lecture, just because it helps me personally, but 80% of the class never showed up. Textbook is completely unnecessary; students relied heavily on TAs who provided worksheets and extra help (which was much appreciated). Matt was a decent prof, but I mostly just relied on slides.

WORST prof I've ever had. I don't recommend going to lecture. He rambles on about pointless stuff about the material, and does not explain any concepts clearly. Even the TA's have mentioned during office hours that they are even confused with what Dr. Sigal wants and said that the grading is all up for "interpretation". Plus the exams are brutal.

Dr. Sigal is a super nice guy and super passionate about what he teaches. Overall a good class considering how much I was dreading it! Also if you are lucky enough to get Ric Hohn as your TA you will ace this course he is absolutely amazing!

the lectures were kinda boring, I would try so hard to not fall asleep. but he is a good prof that cares about what he is teaching. it was a good class as long as tutorials were attended, and there was a lot of studying done for exams.

There are little works to do in this class. It only has one midterm, one final and 2 assignments. You don't need to study for this course except before the exam. You only need to put a little effort into this course. No attendance grade. Dr. Matthew is a very nice guy.

I took this class last year with Prof. Tafreshi and didn't work very hard so I decided to take it again to bring my mark up. Big mistake. He is very boring in lecture, doesn't explain things properly, and doesn't make any connections between what he's teaching and psychology. Try to avoid taking it with him. Take it with Tafreshi instead.
Honestly you get what you put in. He's new to sfu so he may not be the best at explaining things but he tried his best. Exams were long but not too difficult if you knew what you were doing.

Just don't ever take his classes lol he looks nice but he doesn't know how to teach, and his test is way too hard and long. My friend is majoring in stat and she is learning what we are learning... he expects us to be stat experts.

Not enough practice questions given, then exams were analytical (40% avg.) and extremely long. Lectures were very boring, blasts through without theory, connection, or explanation. Impatient with theoretical questions. Prepare for the worst. Worst class i ever took. RUN.
He is not very organized and mostly just reads off of his slides instead of teaching. Class is pretty boring. He is a nice guy but I would take the class with someone else if you can.
His midterm is sooo long with so many questions. Many of my friends could not finish it. I did not get the short questions done. His lecture is boring but he seems nice.

Donna was a great lecturer. I am someone who HATES all things that are even slightly related to math so I was hesitant to take this required course. All I can say is thank goodness someone like Donna was teaching it. Her notes and lectures are all clear and concise and she's ALWAYS there for extra help when you need it. It's not an easy A though!

Donna is a fantastic professor, she is always accessible outside of class and will go over things with you 10 times if you want her to. She expects students to work for marks and to actually engage with the material. She also does her best to make the material as interesting as possible. Would highly recommend.

Ambitiously tries synthesis-over-repetition, tricksy wording critical thought approach; doesn't have grasp of pedagogy it takes yet. Specific-yet-opaque expectations, with subtle cues for that don't actually exist; go see her, or be a telepath.  Data pulled out of hat (A&B   A+B  no). Effectively gave everyone bonus (this stats class is curved).

The chapter notes that Donna has written were the single most helpful learning tool that I have ever encountered in my university career. She is extremely knowledgeable not just about statistics but about psychology too. I would take any course with her.

Donna was an amazing statistics teacher. This was my second time taking this course as I received a C- when I took it four years ago. I ended up with a B in this class because of how organized and clear Donna was. She breaks things down really well and is always open for questions! Would highly recommend!
Really helpful and explains things clearly. Would take again.

I loved her. Donna was extremely caring and extremely accessible outside of class. I  came to her for help regarding my midterm, and she even offered to go for coffee with me to discuss what I did wrong. Despite the fact that I'm probably going to end up with a C-, I strongly recommend Donna.
I don't think I ever had a more dedicated professor at SFU. She is a great teacher!

Even though I really don't like stats, I thought Donna was a great prof and made it as interesting as possible. She made her own notes instead of using a text book, and reading them over before class is very helpful. The exams are fair, and there's two assignments which should help bring your grade up as well.

I really enjoyed Donna's lectures. She makes the material interesting and is really passionate about what she teaches. I also like that she encourages us to think critically. The class can be tough at times but she's always available for help. Just make sure you keep up with the material.
Donna is the nicest prof I have ever had in SFU. She is super caring and gives out clear lecture notes written by herself. Do the weekly readings, it's usually 10 pages long and you will do fine.

Material is clearly presented and very relevant. There is no reason not to get a good grade in this course if you do the reading and put the time and effort into doing the assignments (which should look and sound professional). Jodi and the TA's in this course were extremely helpful --- always available for contact.

It's been a refreshing experiencing learning from Bertrand. He is a fantastic instructor who really cares about his students and the quality of their education. If you get the chance to take one of his courses or tutorials take it!

Took PSYC 308 (not in the option to choose). He's a good storyteller, does go off topic but somehow manages to get through all stuff and even finish class early. Though I personally suck at history whatsoever, his way of talking/teaching made the materials sound extra interesting, lectures were fun, the whole semester with him was amazing.

Bert is a phenomenal TA. He was extremely accessible, compassionate, and witty. He always took time to check in with his students, was reasonable with assignment grading, and took additional time to go over questions before submitting. He always vouched for his students and pushed me to succeed far beyond what I thought was capable.

Bert was my TA for psyc 210 and was incredible. He was very compassionate, not at all condescending, and never made anyone in class feel dumb. Online accessibility was no problem as he was willing to meet whenever worked best for the student, despite him having other responsibilities. I would take a class or tutorial again with him in a heartbeat.

Funny guy. No textbook. Lectures can get confusing. Need to spend extra time self studying. HW and exams include stuff that doesnt get taught in class. First time actually teaching the class, but I would not take a class with him again. Goes off topic easily. But again, super funny dude. Makes lecture enjoyable-even thoguh i dont learn anything.

Bert wasn't my professor. He was my TA for 210. 
I would recommend everyone to take a class with him if they have the opportunity. What an interesting person he is. He grades fairly and makes tough course material seem more approachable. He really prepares you for the exam as well.
Bert is my TA for 210, he's very open to feedback if the way he's explaining things isn't working for you, very engaging and talks to students as equals. I'd take more courses with him if I could.
Didn't have him as a prof but as a TA for 210 and thought I should put it out there that he is the best TA I've ever had, he may be eccentric but is the most caring TA ever.

Her class was great, wonderful, and enjoyable.  Very well thought out lectures that are very precise yet fully explained.  To those who disagree, if you REALLY listened during lecture, you would know I am right.

only read the book. Weekly quizzes were easy and fair. Most questions came from the textbook lol. Prof is very understanding and didnt want to stress us out so she gave many extensions and reduce the workload for us.

lectures arent helpful, the tas are, but honestly i only relied on the textbook for this class. I got 100% on every assignment except for the last few where I fell behind on the readings due to other classes workloads. Her test and assignment questions are very fair. She is understanding and gave many extensions to everyone when i asked for one

SO, go to your TA tutorials. That is how I passed. Elizabeth is AMAZING and keep up with the weekly quizzes. Annoying with auto grading for online but shes really not bad. Go to tutorial and read the textbook to learn. DO WEEKLY QUIZZES and you will be more than fine.

she is so slow and disorganized. Half the class (like legit half) asked her to talk faster and stop doing pointless elaborations on simple things we already know, but she wont go any faster because one person is confused. Its week 2 and we are a lecture behind already because we only managed to cover 6 slides in week 1. Avoid her all costs
Extremely disorganized and boring. Not helpful at all, just confuses you more when you ask her a question. Talks in circles and has no structure to her lessons.

This class was painfully boring. She talks to students like they are children and is really disorganized. No need to attend lecture, and probably better off not attending since she will just confuse you. Tests are easy though if you read the text.

This was my least favorite class. Her lectures are confusing and uninteresting, as is the subject matter. The tutorials didn't really help either. Felt like I was lost at sea. I was better able to understand material if I didn't go to lectures. Midterm and final only. no assignments. be prepared going in and stay on top of everything

Dr. Fouladi was a fine prof. She cares about students and wants them to succeed. Lectures are good for introducing concepts but they're not that detailed and don't give the best examples, go to tutorial for questions/practice. Your TA is your best friend, get help when you need it. PSYC 210 isn't hard if you're decent with numbers.

Dr. Fouladi makes class interesting, however, her teaching can get disorganized or go ahead of herself. printing out lecture slides is recommended since she does a lot of over head writing. Tutorials are helpful in clarifying things. Tests are tricky.

Rachel, is  a great person, and she is very nice, but don't let that fool you because her tests are VERY tough. the course only had exams so if you didn't do well on the exams you are pretty much screwed, there is no other way to show that you understood the course material, only exams.

Rachel is awesome. She's hilariously animated. She explains the material way better than the textbook, at least that's what I found. She's so approachable and helpful, holds study sessions once a week on top of her office hours. She is honestly just the nicest prof ever. 1 MT and 1 final so make sure you utilize her knowledge so you do well!
It's all exam based so you really have to do well.  Wish there was incentives to go to lab or do weekly assignments.  Material is very easy to get lost in

Dr. Fouladi is such a sweet lady who seems to care for her students. However, she's very disorganized in general. Doesn't use Canvas so she communicates and sends everything out by email, sometimes forgetting to attach her lecture slides or attaching the wrong file. Otherwise, super easy course with minimal effort needed if you're decent at math.

Statistics is boring, but she makes it fun because she's so animated. It's good to ask for help during her office hours because she explains more in depth. Her exams are hard if you don't know the material. But after experiencing the midterm, the final is pretty easy since you get the hang of it.
Great teacher-- makes the course bearable

I am shocked at the number of bad ratings for this lady. She is amazing. So sweet and clear at explaining concepts I found very intimidating. I did great in this course thanks to her great style and organization. She's amazing.

Lectures are useless- didn't ever go. Only attended Tutorials & I had an amazing TA. I didn't even buy the book- but do study her lectures notes cus sometimes she summarizes important "theories." Exams are tough but go to J's cram session & ask for help in tutorials. Make sure you practice examples!!

How is she still teaching this class...?? You can read the text and grasp the material before lecture, go to class and come out totally lost. Attend tutorial and take a lot of notes, rely heavily on the T.A. Midterm worth 40%, final worth 60%. GO TO TUTORIAL ALWAYS! Nice enough woman but cannot teach.

Looking back, I probably shouldn't have gone to lectures. Not only was it just not helpful, it made things a thousand times harder than they needed to be. The material is not hard, it's her wordings and explanations that confused almost all of the class. Exams were much easier than expected based on material presented in class. Depend on your TAs.

Very lady/quirky lady but to repeat what others said, she presents the material as much more difficult than it actually is. I had an amazing TA who explained things much more clearly. You don't really have to go to class (so boring) as long as you read the text.

She is super nice. Her lectures aren't that clear, but it helps a LOT if you read the textbook before lecture and then go to the tutorials and do your hw. Tests aren't difficult, just be sure to study theory (from the text) as well as how to do computational problems.

She's really nice, but she teaches material in a very complex way. My TA (Patrick) taught me everything I learned. Content/Exams aren't too bad. Put in a decent amount of work, ask questions in tutorials, attend J's cram sesh and you should be good.

When in class the material is really confusing, but I found that if you went to her office hours she went over it in much more detail and a clearer manner. I had a terrible TA who was fairly useless. Definitely make sure you understand how to apply the concepts! Overall Rachel is a really nice prof, just seek her out during office hours

She seems really nice and I kind of feel bad saying this but she is THE WORST PROF EVER! I cannot explain how bad of a prof she is, she does NOT know how to explain things clearly. TA's make everything clear and the cram session with jay was AMAZING LOVE HIM so good at explaining things/funny Overall, go to tut and you'll do decent.

At first this class seemed really hard, but I think that was just because she made the material way tougher than it needed to be. My TA helped me through this class and I ended up with an A. Midterm and final were actually very easy, in comparison to the way the material was presented in lecture. GPA boost.

Honestly I'm not sure what ppl are talking about saying how she's a bad prof... The material is hard for sure and I freely admit I'm probably one or the worst when it comes to math and she explained things really well.  She genuinely cares about her students succeeding and is always available outside class for questions.  Very approachable.

Course is difficult becuase most psyc students are not used to seeing #s/graphs in this way. TA/Tutor is mandatory because Fouldadi is terrible at teaching. I attended most classes but honestly learned nothing from her.Not good at expressing concepts.Goes round in circles about unimportant material.Hope shes gone soon since most profs can do better

Bad prof. She serisouly should not be teaching. She flies over important concepts. For m/c exams she actually puts e)none of the above. She told us before the exam there would only be 1 answer none of the above so if we got more than 1 we were wrong somewhere, turns out there were 3. Not nice! TA's are a must, but if you get David Prime, switch!

I'm sure she has a good heart but I really do not like her style. She is over the top with her screaching voise and hands above her head when lecturing. She talks way too much during exams. During lecture info that can be explained in 5 mins takes her 20 mins. Good news is course is easy. Be best friends with your TA as they are helpful.

Yes, this class can be considered difficult. The concepts are not easy for someone who is not familiar with statistics (like me). I dreaded taking the class. She wants to help, if you want her to slow down, ask her she is happy to go over anything. Use the textbook, talk to TA's! With dedication I got an A+ and hate statistics a little bit less.

She is an incompetent teacher. She gives too much importance to irrelevant things and doesnt explain important concepts very well. She doesn't believe in brackets "()" in formulas so doesn't include them in the questions. But to get the right answer you have to pretend the brackets are there. She doesn't know what shes teaching!

well, I have to say she is a nice prof, but the way she presents the materials are really difficult,she teaches quite differently from the text as well as the TA's,however,TA are EXTREMELY important!!Also,do attend her lecture because she gave out a lot of examples that she might include in her exams.
She made this course seem harder than it actually is. Read the textbook and get help from your TA, you will be fine. Nice person though. Hate the assignments, so time consuming.

Ridiculous class. The lectures were so boring, the assignments were SO time consuming for a mere 3%, not to mention not even that helpful for studying for exams. The exams are all MC, with SIX options. If this class consisted only of a lecture I would not understand anything. An awesome TA is the only reason I'm getting a decent mark in the class.

Rochelle spends way too much time explaining simple things and then flies over the difficult formulas and questions. Her assignments are ridiculously long and too difficult (50 true or false Qs, seriously?!) and have nothing to do with the midterm/final. A colossal waste of time, and in the end, only worth 3% of your final grade.

She is the worst teacher I've ever had. She treats you like a preschooler, giving a billion examples for unnecessary items (i.e. 10 is greater than 5 which is greater than 3). It's a mandatory course but I actually dropped it to take it with anothe professor just cause of her. She's nice but extremely redundant.
of course it's boring, it's statistics, what do you expect? i love her enthusiasm though! and all her jokes. shes a riot. you can tell she really cares about her students.

I agree that she is indeed a very nice person. Assignments are tricky but tests are not hard (the questions are usually from the textbook). But her 3-hour lecture is like the most boring lecture I've had to listen in my entire life. She talks too much about something that is not that important. And there is only one washroom break.

Assignments are not easy, but exams are all multiple choice. If you know all the notes and assignments, you'll do well on exams. She's very passionate and enthursiastic about stats, and makes jokes that don't seem funny at all. Lecture is really boring, but still go just cause those are the things that will be on the exam. Office hours help too.

Very friendly and ENTHUSIASTIC, but kinda all over the place.  Will spend a lot of time on easy things then blaze through the hard stuff.  Tests all multiple choice.  Don't fall behind or you'll be screwed...

Rachel is very nice and obviously interested in what she teaches, but spends way too long on the easy stuff and rushes through the difficult things. Hwk takes a long time and worth very little, but help to study. Lectures make you want to sleep.
very dry and boring...hard not to sleep in the class. she tries to make it as simple as possible. too much hw. i found the midterms (all mc) to be brutal, unlike others. read all her notes carefully!

Class material is not that difficult, but she makes it very complicated. She adds too many unnecessary words to throw you off. HWs are pretty tough but midterm was easy. Definitely need tutorials. TAs very helpful.

Her hw is sometimes hard, so go and ask the t.a.(s) Her midterm is really easy. You might as well just read her notes, because she teaches more than the book has.  She is kinda slow but it helps to drop down what she saids because she includes it similarly in midterm.

Psyc 210 was my first Stats class. Ric was a very thorough in his lectures, and I had a good TA to work through examples with. It was a tough class but I found I excelled at it without previously knowing any stats or much math. Ric explains things very well so it pays to go to lecture even though he has recorded lectures. Go to Tut's helps.

Super clear with what you should expect from the course since the beginning of the semester. I thought his in-class examples really helped in understanding abstract components in stats. Overall, would take another course with Ric again!
Super fair in everything!!!!

Richard explains things well but maybe can be monotonous sometimes. He is also very supportive and passionate. His canvas is so organized, he also has online lectures on youtube. However, the average was C for class because the material is difficult I guess. For me it was easy cause I like math!
Peter was really bad, he obviously didn't want to be there and had no interest in teaching anything. I didn't learn anything at all from him, avoid him!

Absolutely terrible professor - extremely condescending, rude, and has a clear disinterest of being there. I cannot even count how many sarcastic/snide remarks he made about the class and how he wished he were elsewhere. Don't bother asking him for help unless you want to feel like you are stupid. AVOID! Take this course with another professor.
Really bad... tests are hard as heck... even the TA's said some of his q's are really unfair...

He is horrible.Hot yes, but he's an ass.He actually rolls his eyes when you ask him qs or is very short when answering a q. He is constantly sighing heavily and reminding us that this is an incredibly boring subject- real motivating. He also explains more than is necessary(not in a good way), making it even more confusing. Avoid!!!

He was okay for his first semester teaching. Class isn't that hard. if you dont study what do you expect? i got a B+ because i constantly went to the lab for all assigments - easy 100%. Try to go to lectures even though you dont have to.. it stil helps. He will probably get better at explaining concepts. Made a lot of mistakes, but He's Hot :)

Peter was alright for his first semester teaching. The class is difficult but if you go to the lab you will do fine. Peter is helpful! If you use the lab for assignments you'll get 100% plus it's good study prep for exams. exams are difficult. If you dont study you will fail.  you dont have to attend class to do well. Just study study study...
Peter was great. He went out of his way to help me with my questions. I went to all the lectures and got A+ for the course. It is a really hard course though.
He is not interesting in teaching the course. His test are no fair at all! study really hard and hopefully you will get a good grade. Good luck if you have him cause you will need it!!

Give the guy a break! If people did poorly it wasn't for Peter's lack of effort!  The only people I saw complaining about marks where the ones that never attended lecture and never bothered to go to the lab. Study, ask questions, go to the lab and you'll do fine.

AVOID!! Terrible prof. Makes countless mistakes on notes, study sheets, and EXAMS. Thinks it's funny when he has to to correct his errors during exam. Makes it very stressful! Definitely should NOT be teaching and I'm filing a complaint. Take 210 with another prof.

If you have experience on statistics courses, this is a easy course for you. Lesley is also a very nice prof and able to explain questions very well. She offered so much help and made sure we did well in this course. Her exams were fair and no trick questions. you are able to bring a cheat-sheet but make sure you copy correct formula

Dr. Schimanski is a great professor! Her explanations are clear and her assignments and tests are fair if you just do the homework. She is also extremely nice to talk to and takes the time to help with homework. I would hands down suggest taking a class with her.
Fair exams and assignments. Clear explanations and super friendly. Our class had a super high average so unfortunately some people got bumped down a grade or so.

She has a soft & quite voice so don't sit in the back, you won't be able to hear her. Textbook only used for tutorial homework, the exams are based on lectures & understanding. Cheat sheet allowed so no need to memorize formulas. The assignments are a little confusing (criteria not very specific), communicate with the ta since they are marking it.

Lesley made this class so much easier and more straightforward than I thought it would be! She explains things really well and is always available if you need extra help. Definitely recommend taking this class with her
